message_1: How many ways are there to choose a committee of three people from a group of nine, considering that two of the people must be chosen in all cases?
message_2: Since two of the people must be chosen in all cases, we are essentially choosing the third person for the committee from the remaining seven people (9 - 2 = 7). There are 7 ways to choose the third person, so there are 7 ways to form the committee with the two required people.
